definition: to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Intercession is the chief means appointed by God to bring the great redemption within the reach of all.
sentences.chinese: 而代祷则是神所定规将救赎带给所有的人的主要途径。

sentences.english: For the Lord, the Lord of armies, is about to make destruction complete in all the land.
sentences.chinese: 因为主万军之耶和华在全地之中必成就所定规的结局。

sentences.english: "The problem is that conforming to noraptms is an easy and safe spot to be in, " Bellezza told The Wall Street Journal.
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，遵守定规是一种简单而安全的做法。

sentences.english: That's much easier said than done, because the process of change is random.
sentences.chinese: 这说起来容易做起来难，因为变化的过程是无定规的。

sentences.english: So far, no method has been found which would make it possible to invent hypotheses by rule.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，还没有找出方法，能够按定规创造假说。

definition: to hold tight/to cling to/to adhere/stubborn/to detain sb as prisoner
